confession.seduction_context: Her husband had just died as a result of a fight with Nicolas Hachon of Reillon over a bull. Hachon had struck him and knocked him against a heap of manure. As she desired to pursue vengeance for this homicide, being greatly troubled and upset, she went to Donnepvre to seek the late mayor Demenge marchal procureur for assistance - on the way was met by Mre Parsin (the devil)
sabbat_activities: drinking water from tin or lead cup
holding candles that threw red fire
devil appearing as large black horse among them demanding worship
devil saying 'You will follow me in spite of yourselves'
making hailstorms (reluctantly, had to be compelled due to her poverty)
destroying flowers on oak trees so there would be no acorns
swearing not to accuse one another
seeing witches already executed at Domjevin

testimony.quarrel_subject: Exchange of share in accused's house (belonging to his wife) for a garden. When his wife went to collect fruits from garden, Margueritte prevented her by force
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle s'en donroit bien de garde

testimony.quarrel_subject: Repeated husband's account of quarrel over garden fruits
About two and a half years before had negotiated to hire daughter of accused as servant, then had decided she was too small; eventually taken on by his brother-in-law Aubertin

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: Some months later accused came to house, ostensibly to see her daughter; his wife was 'en couches', and 15 days later her child died

testimony.quarrel_subject: His hens had got into her barn and eaten some grain, then he found one killed behind her house
Repeated husband's story about refusal to hire her daughter
Some 5 years before his little son had been beaten by Margueritte's son; he ran after the latter and struck him
Some 2 years before he had hired her daughter Jehenne, and had agreed as part of price to thresh some oats. Didn't do this in time, and she came to fields to reproach him
Just before last harvest had wanted to set off 2 blancs she owed him against money he owed her - she had been unwilling to agree to this, and he had been angry
Around same time her husband lost an 'empasteur' from front of house; when Margueritte realised she was suspected of stealing it she came and beat the witness's servant
testimony.threat_quote: Voila ung beau boeuf dieu le sauve

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next morning it was found dead in stable

testimony.quarrel_subject: He had a rather wild horse, which ran after those of the accused, and struck her daughter Zabey who was guarding them. That evening Margueritte lay in 'embuscade' for his sister, who was guarding his horses, and jumped on her, seizing her by the neck and trying to force her to the ground
testimony.threat_quote: que sy elle l'eust tenue de bonne facon, elle s'en eust senty longtemps

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: Next day his wife met Margueritte at well, and asked why she had done this
His sister went to fetch water from well behind house, which had previously belonged to brother of accused, and mysteriously fell in

witnesses.name: Claudatte veuve de Demenge le Banc
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: possibly related by marriage to deceased husband

testimony.quarrel_subject: Around that time had dispute, and accused forced her to ground, saying she would strangle her, but didn't do so. Then told story of dispute over fruits three years before

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after dispute over fruits three years before

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: First interrogation. She generally denied all charges or said she didn't remember. Said she was native of Veho, daughter of Francois Gerard and Allison Thomas, aged about 40, late husband had been a laboureur

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses. Jean Vaultrin added that she had asked him to assist her to go to Nancy to find a holy man from Italy to determine if she was a witch or not. She generally admitted circumstantial detail but denied causing any evil

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture request

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. Withstood thumbscrews and rack for long time, but at end of session made brief statement that she had been a witch for three years. Released until after dinner to be shaven and have clothes changed. After dinner confessed she had been seduced 7 years before

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Told of two more sabbats and accomplices

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Confirmed essential of earlier confessions. Was more specific about identification of accomplices but uncertain

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Margueritte Francois
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Claude Marchal
accomplices_named.context: Named after being pressed and placed on rack to frighten her. Thought she recognised him because 'il jette un peu les jambes de travers, et qu'il bretonne en parlant' (he throws his legs a bit sideways and speaks with a Breton accent), but he had been masked and she couldn't be sure

accomplices_named.name: Nicolas Raimbault
accomplices_named.context: Her co-accused, named at sabbat but she could not be sure of identification

accomplices_named.name: Jean Goudot
accomplices_named.context: Said she had heard some others name him, but she did not want to maintain this herself

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Francois
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle s'en donroit bien de garde
notable_quotes.english: she would take good care of it/she would be on guard
notable_quotes.context: Threat during quarrel about fruits in garden with Dieudegnon Claude's wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Francois
notable_quotes.context: Said to Bastien Mariatte when he struck her son after his son had beaten Bastien's child

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Francois
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle l'eust tenue de bonne facon, elle s'en eust senty longtemps
notable_quotes.english: if she had held her properly, she would have felt it for a long time
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Claude Dieudegnon's wife after being asked why she attacked his sister

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Vaultrin
notable_quotes.french: de l'assister d'un homme pour aller a Nancy, lequel respondit qu'il ne pouvoit et que sy elle s'en alloit, elle seroit de son droict tort, laquelle repliqua qu'elle y vouloit aller a ce de trouver ung certain religieux venu d'Italye qu'ilz appelloient ung St homme pour savoir de luy sy elle estoit bonne ou mauvaise C'est a dire Sorciere ou non
notable_quotes.english: to assist her with a man to go to Nancy, to which he responded that he could not and that if she went, she would be wronging herself, to which she replied that she wanted to go there to find a certain religious man come from Italy whom they called a holy man to know from him if she was good or bad, that is to say a witch or not
notable_quotes.context: Jean Vaultrin's addition during confrontations - Margueritte had asked him before her imprisonment to help her go to Nancy to consult a holy man from Italy to determine if she was a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Francois
notable_quotes.french: Et comme elle desiroit de poursuyvre la vindicte de ceste homicide, l'ayant prinse merveilleusement a contrecoeur et estant de ce fort troublée et faschée s'en alla a Donnepvre y querir le feu Maire Demenge marchal procureur pour l'assister
notable_quotes.english: And as she desired to pursue vengeance for this homicide, having taken it marvelously to heart and being greatly troubled and upset by it, she went to Donnepvre to seek the late Mayor Demenge marchal procureur for assistance
notable_quotes.context: Her confession about the circumstances of her seduction by the devil - her husband had just died from a fight with Nicolas Hachon, and on her way to seek legal assistance she met the devil

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte Francois (describing sabbat)
notable_quotes.french: il y a environ deux ans qu'elles furent au sabbat audit bois de Genouy pour la derniere fois auquel lieu elles y banquetteroient ayant du roti comme d'une espaulle de mouton ou couchon. Que le malling esprit mit par piece et leur donna chacun sa part, et leur sembloit qu'elle beuvoient de l'eaue avec un bocq d'estain ne sachant bonnement toutesfois sy c'estoit estain plomb, ny autrement, et avoient des chandelles que ledit esprit malling leur mettoit en la main, jettant un feu rouge et n'appercevant rien autre chose que ledit feu Combien qu'elles pensent tenir une mesme chandelle, et cependant le mesme esprit se mect en guyse d'ung gros cheval noir entr'eulx et se faict adorer leur disant Vous me suivrez en despit de vous puis disparoient tous
notable_quotes.english: about two years ago they were at the sabbat in the said wood of Genouy for the last time at which place they banqueted having roasted meat like a shoulder of mutton or pig. That the evil spirit cut into pieces and gave each their part, and it seemed to them that they drank water from a cup of tin not knowing well however if it was tin, lead, or otherwise, and they had candles that the said evil spirit put in their hands, throwing a red fire and perceiving nothing else but the said fire although they think they hold the same candle, and meanwhile the same spirit puts itself in the guise of a large black horse among them and has itself worshipped saying to them 'You will follow me in spite of yourselves' then they all disappeared
notable_quotes.context: Unusual detailed description of sabbat with banquet, candles, and the devil as a black horse

notable_quotes.speaker: Judges/court record
notable_quotes.french: et consideré que nonobstant l'apprehension qu'elle a heu de la question elle n'en a voulu accuser autres et maintenu en saine conscience n'en scavoir davantage, l'avons faict mettre en bas
notable_quotes.english: and considering that notwithstanding the apprehension she had of the torture she did not want to accuse others and maintained in good conscience not to know any more, we had her taken down
notable_quotes.context: Faint note of worry in the record - the judges noting that even under threat of torture she was reluctant to name accomplices and maintained she knew no more

relationships.evidence_text: veuve Dieudonné du Banc de Reillon
daughter of Francois Gerard and Allison Thomas
Claudatte veuve de Demenge le Banc
well behind house, which had previously belonged to brother of accused
wanted to set off 2 blancs she owed him against money he owed her
he had hired her daughter Jehenne
Her husband had just died as a result of a fight with Nicolas Hachon of Reillon, over a bull

economic_context.details: Multiple property and financial disputes: (1) Exchange of share in accused's house for a garden led to quarrel over fruits; (2) Debt dispute with Vaultrin Henry Colas over 2 blancs she owed him vs money he owed her; (3) Payment dispute with Jean Febuay over threshing oats as part of price for hiring her daughter; (4) Theft accusation over an 'empasteur' (possibly a paste-making tool); (5) Fight over a bull that resulted in her husband's death. Margueritte appears to have been economically vulnerable as a widow with children to support.

harms_catalog.victim_name: stillborn child of Dieudegnon Claude's wife
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Exchange of share in house for garden, accused prevented wife from collecting fruits
Refusal to hire her daughter as servant (decided she was too small)
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: Some months later accused came to house, wife was 'en couches', and 15 days later child died

harms_catalog.harm_description: illness that was cured when Margueritte brought him an 'escuelle de lait' (bowl of milk) - believed her to have both given and cured illness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: His hens had got into her barn and eaten some grain, then he found one killed behind her house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder (confessed under torture she took form of cat and gave illness, then cured him on reflecting he was neighbor)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Hens got into her barn and ate grain

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for month 'comme perturbé d'esprit' (like disturbed in spirit/mind)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: His little son had been beaten by Margueritte's son; he ran after and struck her son
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder near door of poisle (confessed: sprinkled powder near door for the sickness of the children, later used white powder to heal them)

harms_catalog.harm_description: internal illness, which lasted fortnight - both children recovered 'par permission divine'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness struck her son after he beat witness's son

harms_catalog.harm_description: knee trouble, which lasted a year
harms_catalog.economic_value: Had to give her money to pay for threshing
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He had hired her daughter and agreed to thresh oats as part of price. Didn't do this in time, and she came to fields to reproach him

harms_catalog.harm_description: horse became ill, languished for 8 days, and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Debt dispute - wanted to set off 2 blancs she owed him against money he owed her, she was unwilling, and he was angry
Accused saw ox returning from fields and said 'Voila ung beau boeuf dieu le sauve'

harms_catalog.harm_description: fever, and still felt herself much enfeebled
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband lost an 'empasteur' from front of house; when Margueritte realised she was suspected of stealing it she came and beat the witness's servant

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell seriously ill, remained so for 9 or 10 weeks, being thought likely to die; on becoming a little better went to accused's house and asked for white cheese. After eating this became quite better
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused attacked witness's sister, wife confronted her about it the next day at well
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder in soup (confessed: took form of cat and put powder in soup; later used cheese to cure her)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Same sequence of events - after wife recovered by eating cheese
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: at same time as wife's recovery

harms_catalog.harm_description: mysteriously fell in well - he was quick enough to save her with a ladder
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Previous physical assault - Margueritte lay in 'embuscade' for sister and jumped on her, seizing by neck

Sabbat arranged to destroy flowers on oak trees so there would be no acorns

economic_hardship_indicators: Accused was poor widow with children to support
Confession states she was reluctant to make hail 'pour sa pauvreté' (due to her poverty)
Multiple small debt disputes over 2 blancs, threshing costs
Daughter working as servant to supplement family income

prior_legal_disputes.description: Her husband died as a result of fight with Nicolas Hachon over a bull. Hachon struck him and knocked him against heap of manure. She was seeking legal vengeance/assistance from mayor when she met the devil
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Unknown - she was on way to get legal help when seduced by devil

prior_legal_disputes.description: She beat Hellenix's servant after servant called her daughter a thief
Accused suspected of stealing 'empasteur' from Hellenix's husband
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Accused beat the servant in response to suspicion

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Shaven and had clothes changed after torture on presumption of 'pacte taciturne'

hearsay_chains.content: heard some others name Jean Goudot as accomplice, but she did not want to maintain this herself

emotional_state_notes: Generally denied all charges or said she didn't remember
Withstood thumbscrews and rack for long time before confessing
Reluctant to name accomplices even under torture threat
Wanted to consult holy man from Italy to determine if she was witch or not

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Agreed she had beaten Hellenix's servant, who had called her daughter a thief
Denied assault on Claude Dieudegnon's sister

third_parties.name: Jehenne
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: employed by Jean Febuay, considered for employment by Jean du Bois and brother-in-law Aubertin
third_parties.context: Accused's daughter who worked as servant

third_parties.name: Zabey (daughter of accused)
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: was guarding horses when struck by Claude Dieudegnon's horse
third_parties.context: Daughter of accused involved in incident with horses

third_parties.name: Son of Margueritte (unnamed)
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: beat Bastien Mariatte's son; was struck by Bastien
third_parties.context: Involved in quarrel that precipitated illness of Bastien's children

third_parties.name: Aubertin
third_parties.context: Eventually hired accused's daughter as servant; shared house with Jean du Bois

third_parties.name: Nicolas Hachon
third_parties.context: Struck accused's husband in fight over bull, knocking him against manure heap, resulting in his death. This event led to accused's seduction by devil

third_parties.name: Demenge marchal
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: procureur she sought for legal assistance
third_parties.context: Late mayor of Donnepvre whom she was seeking for legal help after husband's death

third_parties.name: Francois Gerard
third_parties.context: Father of accused, died when she was small after moving to Reillon

third_parties.name: Allison Thomas
third_parties.context: Mother of accused, died when she was small

third_parties.name: Dieudonné du Banc
third_parties.context: Deceased husband, had been a laboureur, died from fight with Nicolas Hachon

third_parties.name: servant of Hellenix
third_parties.context: Was beaten by accused after calling her daughter a thief

third_parties.name: sister of Claude Dieudegnon (unnamed)
third_parties.context: Was attacked by accused who lay in ambush, seized by neck; later mysteriously fell in well

third_parties.name: religious man from Italy
third_parties.context: Holy man who had come to Nancy; accused wanted to consult him to determine if she was witch or not

third_parties.name: new woman in Reillon
third_parties.context: Accused mentioned there was 'une nouvelle venue a Reillon qui trouveroit bien moyen de vivre' - a newcomer to Reillon who would find a way to live

third_parties.name: Demenge le Banc
third_parties.context: Well that sister fell into had previously belonged to brother of accused, suggesting family connection

third_parties.name: Zabey (daughter of Claudatte)
third_parties.context: Had stillborn child after dispute over fruits

third_parties.name: boys who interrupted assault
third_parties.context: Some boys came on scene and prevented accused from forcing Claude's sister to ground

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimonies, torture confession, and sabbat descriptions. Record shows judicial concern about accused's reluctance to name accomplices even under torture. Unusual detailed description of sabbat banquet. Economic vulnerability as widow appears to be underlying factor in many conflicts. Trial lasted 35 days from first depositions to death sentence approval.
